intro: Senecio chrysanthemoides var. khasianus, commonly known as the Khasi Senecio, is a flowering plant native to the hill regions of northeastern India. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, making it a notable species in local flora. This variant is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and unique morphological features compared to other Senecio species.
